title: Community briefs | Ohio News | herald-dispatch.com
text: Sunrise service set on March 31 PROCTORVILLE — Lucinda Baptist Church will hold a Sunrise Service on Easter, March 31, at 6:30 a.m. Pastor Will Bullock will preach. There will be a full breakfast after the service. Joseph Mullins will preach in the 11 a.m. service on Easter Sunday. Everybody is welcome. Special worship on Good Friday IRONTON — The Ro-Na Theater in Ironton will host Be Hope Worship Night on Good Friday, March 29, at 7 p.m. Be Hope’s worship band will lead worship, and attendees will be invited to participate in reflection, prayer, in communion, and even baptism. The evening is sponsored and organized by Be Hope Church of Ironton. A collection will be taken of money or boxes of cereal for Harvest for the Hungry, a local nonprofit helping to meet food needs in the area. Photo workshop set for April 9 SOUTH POINT — The Women’s Business Center of Central Appalachia will present a Storytelling Through Photography workshop from 11 a.m.-12:30 p.m. on Tuesday, April 9, at the Lawrence County Chamber of Commerce, 216 Collins Ave., South Point. Edwin Martell from Elm Street Photography will teach participants how to elevate their brand’s marketing with storytelling through photography. Martell will teach: how to attract customers by showcasing your services and products; how to tell your brand’s story through photos; tips and tricks to capture the best images; strategies for maximizing your presence on social media platforms; real-life examples of how service-based and product-based businesses can benefit from photography; and the difference between original photos and stock photos, and why originality matters. To register for this free workshop, go online to [eventbrite.com](http://eventbrite.com) and search for “Storytelling Through Photography — South Point, OH.” Application extension set for student aid IRONTON — Ohio University is extending its first priority-date for the 2024-25 Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) to at least April 1. The FAFSA serves as the application for all federal, state and institutional aid at OHIO and its branch campuses. Prospective students are encouraged to submit a FAFSA as soon as possible to ensure best possible consideration for aid. Visit [https://www.ohio.edu/southern/student-financial-aid](https://www.ohio.edu/southern/student-financial-aid) for more details. Applications due for scholarship April 1 ASHLAND — Applications for this year’s Clark Family Scholarship are being accepted through April 1. This yearly scholarship will be awarded to two students who show academic promise and a desire to continue their education after high school. High school seniors expected to graduate in 2024 from public high schools located within Lawrence County, Ohio, or Boyd, Greenup, Carter or Lawrence counties in Kentucky, and planning to attend a 2- to 4-year college or university, trade school, or vocational school are eligible to apply. All applications will be delivered to, and considered by, the Board of Directors of the Clark Family Charity. No applications received after April 1 will be considered. Visit [https://www.myclarkspns.com/scholarship](https://www.myclarkspns.com/scholarship) for more information and to apply. Free Healthy for Life class offered PORTSMOUTH, Ohio — Southern Ohio Medical Center is inviting the community to get “healthy for life” in 2024. Healthy for Life is a free class offered by SOMC Community Health and Wellness. This community-based nutrition and well-being program was created by Aramark and the American Heart Association, and focuses on empowering people to make healthy food, nutrition and lifestyle choices. All classes will take place in the Main Campus Braunlin Building Conference Center, 1725 27th St., Portsmouth, and begin at noon. In the spring, classes will be offered on April 9, April 16 and April 23. During the summer, there will be classes on July 9, July 16 and July 23. Finally, in the fall classes will be held on Oct. 8, Oct. 15 and Oct. 22. Those interested in attending should register ahead of time by calling 740-356-8078. For more information, visit [somc.org](http://somc.org).
